english_translation: Narrated by Ikrima, the freed slave of Ibn Abbas, who said: Allah said to Abraham: 'Indeed, I am about to test you with a matter.' Abraham said: 'Will you make me a leader for the people?' Allah said: 'Yes.' Abraham said: 'Will you make the House a place of return for the people?' He said: 'Yes, and as a place of safety.' Abraham said: 'Will you make us submitters to You?' Allah said: 'Yes.' Abraham said: 'And from our offspring a nation submissive to You?' Allah said: 'Yes.' Abraham said: 'Will you show us our rights of pilgrimage?' Allah said: 'Yes.' Abraham said: 'Will you accept our repentance?' Allah said: 'Yes.' Abraham said: 'Will you make this a safe place?' Allah said: 'Yes.' Allah said: 'And whoever disbelieves, I will give him provision for a time, then I will drive him to the punishment of fire.' Ibn Abi Najjih said: I heard this from Ikrima, then I presented it to Mujahid, and he did not deny it.
